dcterms:description: A comprehensive dataset curated through the generation of simulated dialogues using advanced language models, encompassing a wide array of subjects including Movies, Music, Culture, and Travel, with 500,000 entries segmented into 8,000 unique conversations.
dcterms:title: Pretraining Dataset

dcterms:creator: Yanran Li
Hui Su
Xiaoyu Shen
Wenjie Li
Ziqiang Cao
Shuzi Niu
dcterms:description: A collection of human-to-human conversations representing everyday communication scenarios, annotated for emotion and act labels, consisting of over 13,000 dialogues.
dcterms:title: DailyDialog

dcterms:creator: Sayyed M. Zahiri
Jinho D. Choi
dcterms:description: Based on the TV series 'Friends', this dataset is designed for evaluating emotion recognition in conversations, offering fine-grained emotional annotations across categories such as joy, sadness, anger, and neutral.
dcterms:title: EmoryNLP

dcterms:creator: Soujanya Poria
Devamanyu Hazarika
Navonil Majumder
Gautam Naik
Erik Cambria
Rada Mihalcea
dcterms:description: A multimodal dataset for emotion recognition in conversations, originating from the sitcom 'Friends', containing over 1,400 dialogues and approximately 13,800 annotated utterances.
dcterms:title: MELD

dcterms:creator: Saizheng Zhang
Emily Dinan
Jack Urbanek
Arthur Szlam
Douwe Kiela
Jason Weston
dcterms:description: Provides conversation logs accompanied by persona profiles, fostering the development of personalized dialogue systems, containing thousands of dialogues paired with persona descriptions.
dcterms:title: PersonaChat

dcterms:creator: Kai Sun
Dian Yu
Jianshu Chen
Dong Yu
Yejin Choi
Claire Cardie
dcterms:description: A challenge dataset for dialogue-based reading comprehension, featuring multiple-choice questions derived from dialogues, with over 6,000 dialogues and 10,000 questions.
dcterms:title: DREAM

dcterms:creator: Leyang Cui
Yu Wu
Shujie Liu
Yue Zhang
Ming Zhou
dcterms:description: Focuses on dialogue-based reading comprehension in multi-turn interactions, comprising over 8,000 dialogues and more than 32,000 questions, emphasizing mutual understanding and reasoning within dialogues.
dcterms:title: MuTual
